relation: Jailbreaks iOS 4.0 for devices supported in 3.1.4.
Jailbreaks iOS 4.1 for Apple TV 2G, iPad, iPhone 3G, iPhone 3GS (both bootroms), iPhone 4, iPod touch 3G, and iPod touch 4G.
Enables installing the 06.15.00 baseband on the iPhone 3G and iPhone 3GS
Support for iOS 4.2.1 on every device that is compatible, except for the iPod touch 2G.
Support for iOS 4.3.1 on every device that is compatible, except for the iPad 2.
Support for iOS 4.3.2 on every device that is compatible, except for the iPad 2.
Support for iOS 4.3.3 on every device that is compatible, except for the iPad 2.
includes a fix for the iPhone 3GS / iPhone 4 side switch vibration issue (only for 4.3.3)
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {13212=PwnageTool is expected to remain exclusive to Mac OS X. As of October 2009, iH8sn0w, et. al. has announced that they made a project that will bring PwnageTool's functionality to Windows, called sn0wbreeze. [3], 1611=PwnageTool was released 3 April 2008 but largely unused until version 2.0 was released 19 July 2008. The following versions that are shown here are not beta, alpha, or in development., 12591=This method does have negative aspects. The most common errors are the 16xx range of errors, which mean that the either the firmware file is corrupt or you didn't put it in the right mode (Recovery, DFU Mode). Sometimes the problems could just be a computer problem such as the memory is full or the USB port is broken. The most common error is Error 1604 which means that the firmware file is corrupted.}
